title: When on series, make it only give you your primary.
body:
I would rather wait 5 minutes to get a game and play my best possible role when it really counts. Just an idea. It just makes sense to me to be able to play 100% your best role when you are on your series, as it shows your true skill in that role.

Edit 1: I am asking for this, because it would make your series more consistent. Your series should be displaying your true skill, and your primary role is the role you are most skilled in. It just makes sense to have you play in your most skilled position rather than your sub par role.

A free climb to platinum? Sorry, but the fact of the matter is, half of all players in League of Legends are at Silver IV or below. That means if you are Silver III or higher, CONGRATULATIONS! You are in the upper half of all players. This isn't PokÃ©mon. You can't be the very best like no one ever was. In fact, if you can't climb even with the new promo conditions, then you don't deserve to climb. Period. **Get better.** And be happy that Riot has reduced the number of roles required to play ranked from 4-5 down to 2. If you can't play two fucking roles then you don't deserve to win your promos.  

Seriously. Get good at two non-permabanned champs. That's it. That's all is required to climb now.  

And oh no! I rustled your jimmies! Got your panties in a bunch? Too fuckin bad, you think pro players are pansies who climbed to challenger by asking Riot for an easier climb? Not even close. If you want to climb, do what it takes to do it and stop complaining. No one should have to hand you a thing.  

# The only reason you are asking for these things are because you are not confident that you will climb without them. And therein lies your problem.

> The only reason you are asking for these things are because you are not confident that you will climb without them. And therein lies your problem.

This isnt true. I have climbed from bronze 3 to silver 3 in about 2 months at the end of last season. I am asking for this, because it would make your series more consistent. Your series should be displaying your skill, and your primary role is the role you are most skilled in, meaning it shows your true skill.

I'd argue your true skills is shown further in your wide pool of champions.  

Higher level players (besides a select few) have a wide range of champions and roles that they play. Sure, some of them consider themselves better at one role than another, but they make sure that their other roles are not drastically behind. If you can't play the game itself at the level you think you are at, then you shouldn't be where you are. I'm not saying you should be only ranked as high as your worst role--rather, it's quite reasonable to ask a player to be proficient enough in two roles to deserve being where they are at right now. It used to be 4 or 5. Be glad Riot changed it to 2.  

That said, what I said is very true. If you were more confident in your own champion pool, then some "inconsistency" in gameplay wouldn't shake you. You would know that in a bigger picture, you will end up climbing regardless of some minor setbacks (I'm talking over dozens of games). If you are getting discouraged just because you lost one or two promos, then you are doing things wrong. If you are losing more than that... well, that's why Riot gave you the free promo win. You'll get there eventually. If you deserve it.
